message.content:
cs.SY, cs.RO, cs.AI, cs.CE, cs.ET

Reasoning: 
- cs.SY (Systems and Control): The paper proposes an MPC-based thermal management strategy for the automotive A/C system, which involves control and optimization of the cooling power trajectory to meet passenger comfort requirements while minimizing energy consumption. 
- cs.RO (Robotics): Although the paper is not directly related to robotics, the proposed strategy can be seen as a control problem for regulating the temperature of a closed environment (the vehicle cabin), which is similar to temperature control in robotic systems. 
- cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence): The paper uses an MPC algorithm, which is a type of AI-based control method, to optimize the A/C system performance. 
- cs.CE (Computational Engineering, Finance, and Science): The paper involves the development and evaluation of a physics-based A/C system model (ACSim) for the vehicles with electrified powertrains, which requires computational modeling and simulation. 
- cs.ET (Emerging Technologies): The paper leverages the emerging connected and automated vehicles (CAVs) technology to incorporate vehicle speed preview in the A/C thermal management strategy for further energy efficiency improvement.
